comment: Professor Burton is such a sweetheart. She doesn't take attendance, but does have in-class assignments on days you don't know so it makes you have to come to class. No exams just two quizzes, a couple of group assignments, and one big project due at the end of the semester. Professor Burton was always available if you needed help with anything.

Professor Burton is amazing! There was a lot of work required for her class but none of it was necessarily hard, it just takes solid effort. She is an easy, lenient grader, although it takes forever to get grades back from her. She is also terrible at responding to emails. However, Burton wants to see all of her students succeed and is very kind.

This class is almost exclusively a semester long group project. It is super involved but not hard if you put in the work. She has speakers come in and you have to write a small review. Plus there is a curiosity component  and a few early assignments. No tests or quizzes. She is super nice and cares about learning new information. Great professor!

This is an easy class if you just read the directions and do the work. Yes, there is a lot of writing and most of your papers won't be graded until the end, but the material is very straight forward. Even though it's a marketing class, the material is more on each industry and less on the marketing.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Burton is a super easy grader. Assignments consisted of quizzes, blog projects, paper, group project, and hands-on assignments. I received an A for everything. Group project was a lot of work. Does not respond to emails and takes forever to grade stuff. You can text her, and she will respond very quickly though.

Show up for speaker days (even though most of them are amateurs) and make sure to do all of the assignments. Nothing is hard but it can be time consuming. She did not grade anything until the final day and never responded to my emails. Overall, she's a nice person but she's disorganized. Choose your team wisely for the agency project.

The dean had to be contacted because she was not grading anything or responding to emails for months. Its currently 6 days before grades are due and HALF of our work is still ungraded! She seems really nice but she could not care less about her students. Videos used to teach are 3 years old. The class is all writing. Guaranteed A if you do the work

There were so many Assignments, Blog Posts, Quizzes, Projects, and so forth. They weren't that difficult, but it takes a good amount of time to do everything every week. Also, she did not return grades promptly and we had to wait a long time to know what we got on each item. Lastly, the company analysis was extensive and graded kinda harshly.
She will not grade your papers and quizzes till the end and will never respond when you email her. Her class is all writing.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: If you want to put up with a professor that doesn't communicate well with her students and makes you write essays that you couldn't care less about, take her. the essays are easy but you have to write a lot and its not fun. You most likely will learn nothing from this class.

She teaches very well. Her lectures are informative and she does a lot by bringing in guest speakers to help the students learn. However, she is very unresponsive to her students emails and texts. She doesn't quite know how to use D2l so she messes up when discussions are due and she tends to not do what she says she will do in a timely manner.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: There are lots of easy assignments, and the quizzes are easy. No exams just quizzes and assignments. One group project you can either do alone or with 1 partner. She takes FOREVER to grade assignments so do not expect grades back anytime soon after submitting. She is also impossible to reach and never emails back, but the class is super easy!!!!

Professor Burton is so refreshingly kind I actually wanted to leave a good review for once. I took her over the summer during Covid-19 so things were not the norm. She is the most understanding and kind professor I have ever had. She is always available to help and SO understanding. SHE IS AMAZING! If you have the chance take her!!

There is a lot of work that goes into this class. 8 quizzes (1 drop), 10 practical assignments (1 drop), a blog project, and a company analysis (30-40+ page paper). None of the work is hard at all, but be prepared to actually put in an effort. She is an AMAZING professor and so kind. You can text her questions and she answers asap. Highly recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She's awesome!! Her classes are a lot of work. Most of the quizzes are written exams, but she's a fair grader. Love her class!

I took Social Media Marketing. I love her as a professor, but the class has too much to do! There are multiple projects, the Company Analysis being the longest - 20+ pages! Her teaching style is awesome and I really absorbed every bit of every lecture! I would take her again! Beware, she takes FOREVER to grade.

Not a ton of work. There are a couple quizzes and about 10 assignments, as well as a blog project, and a company analysis. You create your own blog for the blog project. The assignments are making mock-up social media posts for companies to use and overall the material is kind of fun. Tyra posts great videos and the quizzes come straight from there

Awesome Professor, she records audio for the PPT and that's what the material for the tests and quizzes come from so take good notes. She takes a while to grade but if you follow the assignment instructions exactly you'll do fine. The biggest assignments are the blog project and paper.

One huge paper due at the end of semester thats worth a lot of points. Takes a while to get grades back to you but she is not a tough grader. Instructions fo reach assignment are pretty clear. Quizzes and weekly assignments. Blog post and a final and midterm.

I took Professor over the Summer for MKTG 3800 and loved her class. I only got a B because I missed 2 assignments. If you watch the recorded PPT the test, midterm and finals come from those. She really wants her students to do well.

I've taken numerous online classes at KSU and she's by far one of the best online professors I've ever had! She records videos you watch every week (only about 20 minutes long) and they're so helpful! It's like being in class without having to actually go and more to the point. Her quizzes cover exactly what she talked about in the videos

Very heavy courseload for an 8wk class. Would be fine in a 16wk class. Must watch the lecture videos to do well on the quizzes (taking notes on the videos really helps with the quizzes)!! However much effort you put in, your grades reflect it. The more you put it seems the easier she grades/higher your scores

Slow grader. Easy class. Big company analysis project that she allows you to work with one other student on. 10 blog posts on any topic. 10 topic assignments. 10 quizzes. Busy work every week. Didnt reply to emails or answer her phone which she lists as her best contact method on syllabus. Easy class though.

There's definitely a lot of work, but it's usually spaced out well enough that it's not overwhelming. If you follow her rubrics, listen to the lectures, and keep up with the work, you're sure to get an A. She's a very easy grader and very understanding.

Professor Burton is probably one of the best professors I've had at KSU. If you take her class take it! She is easy going and responds swiftly to emails. Just do the work it isn't hard, pretty straight forward and an easy A. Blog project over the semester,weekly assignments/quizzes,midterm,final and research paper that you can have a partner for.

Best professor for marketing! I took her for both social media and entertainment marketing over the summer. There was a lot of work to keep up with but she grades easily and just wants you to do well! Partner project was tedious but we made an A. Overall I made a high A in both classes and learned so much from both! I only wish she taught finance!!

This class has 10 Hands-On Assignments, 2 tests, 4 quizzes, 2 exams, Company Analysis and blog project. The assignments are making your own mock-ups using different social media platforms. Each exam has a timed and non-timed portion. All of the exams and quizzes are short answer questions. Partner on company analysis. Start Early! Very Slow grader!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lots of "busy" work to do. Discussions, replies, weekly quizzes, speaker write ups, and one paper. She's awesome and understanding , but it is a lot of work for a summer online course.

Taken for both Entertainment and Social Media Marketing and would take again if I could. Empathetic to most hardships that come up during the semester and recognizes when students work hard in her class. Has really influenced my career choice and been not only a professor but a mentor.

Social media 2. She set this class up so we could get certified in everything. Do your work on time and you will get an A. Make sure you have a good group for the two group projects, that's where all of your points come from basically. Tests are essay straight from lecture. During review she tells you everything that will be on it. TAKE HER LOVEHER

Digital Marketing Analytics  By far one of the best classes I've taken in my major thus-far. Tyra is an awesome resource and vessel. If you do your work, you will pass. If you do your work and actually show that you care, you will get an A.

Very interesting class! Especially if you're interested in marketing. Overall the class was easy, but you definitely do learn a lot about entertainment marketing. I took her in the summer of 2016 for both Entertainment Marketing and Social Media marketing, both classes are structured mostly the same. Very friendly and helpful.

Professor Burton is awesome. She really knows what she's talking about and let's you have actual application on the topic. I got an internship because I had talking points from her class. Definitely accessible and willing to teach.
Class was pretty easy - just a lot of work in a short time (took over summer semester). Professor was very nice, and really wants students to be successful. She did take forever to grade though.

Love Tyra! I have her now for 4520 and this is the class I love to go to. The material is fun to talk about since it is social media. Two exams, blogs, 1 project, hands on assignments in class, and a paper is all for the class. I plan on taking her again for 3800.

Great teacher! Clear with instructions for assignments, quick responses to questions usually. Bought 2 books for class, used both but were less than $50 combined. Only 2 tests and few quizzes, but most are in essay format so you have to read the material and watch the videos she records for each section. She did take forever to grade things though.

Tyra changed my life. After her class I knew I wanted to go into social media marketing, and the day after I graduated I got a job as a Digital Marketing Specialist for a major company.  I owe everything I know in this field to her classes.  She is a wonderful mentor and an incredible person. Take her and show up to class, you will never regret it!

She is my FAVORITE marketing professor!!! I have taken her twice and I would have taken her more if I could! She is an easy A+, and she is an entertaining professor. She has significantly  influenced my career path! I an not even joking, she has inspired me! She is a wonderful professor. TAKE HER!!!

I have never rated a teacher, but had to for Professor Burton.  Saying she is amazing is an understatement.  She is extremely knowledgable and you will learn things that are actually useful in real life! I would take her class any day and every day.  I wish more professors were like her because I would actually enjoy going to those classes then.

Took her for social media marketing too. one word-AMAZING. She really intellectual but knows how to simplify it just enough for you to understand. Gives great feedback and  outlines test material. (It is a lot but if you study there is no way you shouldn't get an A)

Great professor. Very helpful and puts up videos of her teaching to help students understand better. The subject is difficult to learn but she makes it more interesting. I would suggest taking her for this course. There are 4 tests and online quizzes. Also a team project that is easy, and paired assignments which are relatively easy as well.

Tyra has been one of my favorite professors at Kennesaw in the last 4 years. I have never met someone who loved what they do as much as she does. There is no tricking when it comes to tests (which are all essay) but she makes it clear what she wants. I took her for 2 classes back to back and wish I could take more!

Great Professor, attendance is not required but I would suggest going as she covers all test material in class; you will NOT need the book. Overall a fun class with interesting lectures and very minimal workload. VERY easy on grading, you will get an A.
